sorts an array of quadratic elements The elements are sorted such that the first index is increasing and such that among elements with the same first index, the second index is increasing. For elements with same first and second index, the order is not defined.

index of second variable in element to search for
number of quadratic elements in array
buffer to store position of found quadratic element, or position where it would be inserted

detaileddescription.para: Finds an index pair in a sorted array of quadratic elements. If (idx1,idx2) is found in quadelems, then returns TRUE and stores position of quadratic element in *pos. If (idx1,idx2) is not found in quadelems, then returns FALSE and stores position where a quadratic element with these indices would be inserted in *pos. Assumes that idx1 <= idx2.

briefdescription.para: pointer to store new (reduced) number of quadratic elements

memberdef.name: SCIPexprgraphNodeSplitOffLinear

briefdescription.para: expression graph node where to splitup linear part
length of linvars and lincoefs arrays
buffer to store length of linear term that have been splitup
buffer to store variables of linear part
buffer to store coefficients of linear part

detaileddescription.para: given a node of an expression graph, splitup a linear part which variables are not used somewhere else in the same expression E.g., if the expression is 1 + x + y + y^2, one gets 1 + x and the node remains at y + y^2. If the node is a linear expression, it may be freed. If it is not linear, the node may change, i.e., the remaining nonlinear part may be stored in a new node. It is assumed that the user had captured the node. It is assumed that the expression graph has been simplified before.

briefdescription.para: node where to move parents to

detaileddescription.para: moves parents from a one node to another node in other words, replaces the child srcnode by targetnode in all parents of srcnode srcnode may be freed, if not captured it is assumes that targetnode represents the same expression as srcnode

releases node, i.e., decreases number of uses node is freed if no parents and no other uses children are recursively released if they have no other parents nodes that are removed are also freed if node correspond to a variable, then the variable is removed from the expression graph similar for constants

briefdescription.para: pointer to expression graph node that should be freed

detaileddescription.para: frees a node of an expression graph
enables a node and recursively all its children in an expression graph
disables a node and recursively all children which have no enabled parents in an expression graph
returns whether the node has siblings in the expression graph
returns whether all children of an expression graph node are variable nodes gives TRUE for nodes without children
returns whether the node has an ancestor which has a nonlinear expression operand

detaileddescription.para: creates a sum of expression trees with pairwise disjoint variables from a given node in an expression graph Giving SCIPexprgraphGetNodeNChildren() for exprtreesize is always sufficient.

briefdescription.para: root node of expression graph subtree
array where to count usage of variables, length must be at least the number of variables in the graph

detaileddescription.para: returns how often expression graph variables are used in a subtree of the expression graph
gives the number of summands which the expression of an expression graph node consists of

memberdef.argsstring: (SCIP_EXPRGRAPH *exprgraph, SCIP_EXPRGRAPHNODE *node, int exprtreessize, int *nexprtrees, SCIP_EXPRTREE **exprtrees, SCIP_Real *exprtreecoefs)
memberdef.name: SCIPexprgraphGetSumTrees

briefdescription.para: expression graph node which represents expression to get
length of exprtrees and exptreecoefs arrays, should be at least SCIPexprgraphGetSumTreesNSummands()
buffer to store number of expression trees
array where to store expression trees
array where to store coefficients of expression trees

detaileddescription.para: creates a sum of expression trees, possibly sharing variables, from a given node in an expression graph

briefdescription.para: public methods for expressions, expression trees, expression graphs, and related stuff
